intro: Oreoselinum pseudocarvifolium, commonly known as the false caraway, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. Native to southern Europe and western Asia, this plant thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. Its aromatic leaves and seeds have been used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The plant's botanical features make it a valuable subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
